<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="mk43304_instructions_forming_part_of_t__ins02728"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_mk43304_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>  INSTRUCTIONS<BR>  Forming Part of the Terms and Conditions of the Offer    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Guarantee of Signatures.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No signature guarantee is required on this Letter of Transmittal (a)&nbsp;if this
Letter of Transmittal is signed by the registered holder(s) (which term, for purposes of this Section&nbsp;1, includes any participant in DTC's systems whose name appears on a security position
listing as the owner of the Shares) of the Shares tendered therewith, unless such holder or holders have completed either the box entitled "Special Delivery Instructions" or the box entitled "Special
Payment Instructions" on the cover of this Letter of Transmittal or (b)&nbsp;if the Shares are tendered for the account of a financial institution (including most commercial banks, savings and loan
associations and brokerage houses) that is a member in good standing of the Security Transfer Agents Medallion Program or any other "eligible guarantor institution," as such term is defined in
Rule&nbsp;17Ad-15 of the Exchange Act (each an "Eligible Institution" and collectively "Eligible Institutions") (for example, the Security Transfer Agents Medallion Program, the New York Stock
Exchange Medallion Signature Program and the Stock Exchanges Medallion Program). In all other cases, all signatures on this Letter of Transmittal must be guaranteed by an Eligible Institution. </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>See
Instruction&nbsp;5</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Delivery of Letter of Transmittal and Certificates or Book-Entry Confirmations.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Letter of Transmittal is
to be completed by stockholders if Share Certificates are to be forwarded herewith. A manually executed facsimile of this Letter of Transmittal may be used in lieu of the original. If Shares
represented by Share Certificates are being tendered, such Share Certificates, as well as this Letter of Transmittal properly completed and duly executed with any required signature guarantees, and
any other documents required by this Letter of Transmittal, must be received by the Depositary at its address set forth herein on or prior to the Expiration Date. If Shares are to be tendered by
book-entry transfer, the procedures for tender by book-entry transfer set forth in Section&nbsp;3 of the Offer to Purchase must be followed, and an Agent's Message and confirmation of a book-entry
transfer into the Depositary's account at DTC of Shares tendered by book-entry transfer (such a confirmation, a "Book-Entry Confirmation") must be received by the Depositary on or prior to the
Expiration Date. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stockholders
whose Share Certificates are not immediately available or who cannot deliver all other required documents to the Depositary on or prior to the Expiration Date or who cannot
complete the procedures for book-entry transfer on or prior to the Expiration Date may nevertheless tender their Shares by properly completing and duly executing a Notice of Guaranteed Delivery on or
prior to the Expiration Date pursuant to the guaranteed delivery procedure set forth in Section&nbsp;3 of the Offer to Purchase. Pursuant to such procedure: (a)&nbsp;such tender of such Shares
must be made by or through an Eligible Institution, (b)&nbsp;a properly completed and duly executed Notice of Guaranteed Delivery with respect to such Shares substantially in the form provided by
Purchaser must be received by the Depositary on or prior to the Expiration Date, (c)&nbsp;if such Shares are represented by Share Certificates, such Shares Certificates, as well as this Letter of
Transmittal properly completed and duly executed with any required signature guarantees, and any other documents required by this Letter of Transmittal, must be received by the Depositary at its
address set forth herein within three New York Stock Exchange trading days after the date of execution of such Notice of Guaranteed Delivery and (d)&nbsp;if such Shares are to be tendered by
book-entry transfer, the procedures for tender by book-entry transfer set forth in Section&nbsp;3 of the Offer to Purchase must be followed, and a Book-Entry Confirmation must be received by the
Depositary within three New York Stock Exchange trading days after the date of execution of such Notice of Guaranteed Delivery. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
term "Agent's Message" means a message transmitted through electronic means by DTC to, and received by, the Depositary and forming part of a Book-Entry Confirmation that states that
DTC has received an express acknowledgment from the participant in DTC tendering the Shares that are the subject of such Book-Entry Confirmation that such participant has received and agrees to be
bound by the terms of this Letter of Transmittal and that Purchaser may enforce such agreement against such participant. The term "Agent's Message" also includes any hard copy printout evidencing such
message generated by a computer terminal maintained at the Depositary's office. </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=9,EFW="2226669",CP="KROGER CO.",DN="3",CHK=500160,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK106:[15ZCX4.15ZCX43304]MK43304A.;8',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='18-NOV-2015;11:47' -->

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>THE METHOD OF DELIVERY OF THE SHARES (OR SHARE CERTIFICATES), THIS LETTER OF TRANSMITTAL AND ALL OTHER REQUIRED DOCUMENTS, INCLUDING DELIVERY THROUGH DTC, IS AT
THE ELECTION AND RISK OF THE TENDERING STOCKHOLDER. DELIVERY OF THE SHARES (OR SHARE CERTIFICATES), THIS LETTER OF TRANSMITTAL AND ALL OTHER REQUIRED DOCUMENTS WILL BE DEEMED MADE, AND RISK OF LOSS
THEREOF SHALL PASS, ONLY WHEN THEY ARE ACTUALLY RECEIVED BY THE DEPOSITARY (INCLUDING, IN THE CASE OF A BOOK-ENTRY TRANSFER OF SHARES, BY BOOK-ENTRY CONFIRMATION WITH RESPECT TO SUCH SHARES). IF SUCH
DELIVERY IS BY MAIL, IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT THE SHARES (OR SHARE CERTIFICATES), THIS LETTER OF TRANSMITTAL AND ALL OTHER REQUIRED DOCUMENTS BE SENT BY PROPERLY INSURED REGISTERED MAIL WITH RETURN
RECEIPT REQUESTED. IN ALL CASES, SUFFICIENT TIME SHOULD BE ALLOWED TO ENSURE TIMELY DELIVERY.</B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No
alternative, conditional or contingent tenders will be accepted and no fractional Shares will be purchased. All tendering stockholders, by execution of this Letter of Transmittal (or
facsimile thereof), waive any right to receive any notice of the acceptance of their Shares for payment. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All
questions as to validity, form and eligibility (including time of receipt) of the surrender of any Share Certificate hereunder, including questions as to the proper completion or
execution of any Letter of Transmittal, Notice of Guaranteed Delivery or other required documents and as to the proper form for transfer of any certificate of Shares, will be determined by Purchaser
in its sole and absolute discretion (which may be delegated in whole or in part to the Depositary), which determination will be final and binding. Purchaser reserves the absolute right to reject any
and all tenders determined by it not to be in proper form or the acceptance for payment of or payment for which may be unlawful. Purchaser also reserves the absolute right to waive any defect or
irregularity in the surrender of any Shares or Share Certificate(s) whether or not similar defects or irregularities are waived in the case of any other stockholder. A surrender will not be deemed to
have been validly made until all defects and irregularities have been cured or waived. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Inadequate Space.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the space provided on the cover page to this Letter of Transmittal is inadequate, the
certificate numbers and/or the number of Shares should be listed on a separate schedule attached hereto and separately signed on each page thereof in the same manner as this Letter of Transmittal is
signed. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Partial Tenders (Applicable to Certificate Stockholders Only).</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If fewer than all the Shares evidenced by any
Share Certificate delivered to the Depositary are to be tendered, stockholders should&nbsp;contact the Transfer Agent at (877)&nbsp;248-6417 (toll free in the United States) or
+1&nbsp;(718)&nbsp;921-8317 (international) to arrange to have such Share Certificate divided into separate Share Certificates representing the number of shares to be tendered and the number of
shares to not be tendered. The stockholder should then tender the Share Certificate representing the number of Shares to be tendered as set forth in this Letter of Transmittal. All Shares represented
by Share Certificates delivered to the Depositary will be deemed to have been tendered. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Signatures on Letter of Transmittal; Stock Powers and Endorsements.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If this Letter of Transmittal is signed
by the registered owner(s) of the Shares tendered hereby, the signature(s) must correspond with the name(s) as written on the face of the Share Certificate(s) without alteration or any other change
whatsoever. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
any Shares tendered hereby are owned of record by two or more joint owners, all such owners must sign this Letter of Transmittal. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
any tendered Shares are registered in the names of different holder(s), it will be necessary to complete, sign and submit as many separate Letters of Transmittal (or facsimiles
thereof) as there are different registrations of such Shares. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
this Letter of Transmittal or any certificates or stock powers are signed by trustees, executors, administrators, guardians, attorneys-in-fact, officers of corporations or others
acting in a fiduciary or </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=10,EFW="2226669",CP="KROGER CO.",DN="3",CHK=676076,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK106:[15ZCX4.15ZCX43304]MK43304A.;8',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='18-NOV-2015;11:47' -->

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>representative
capacity, such persons should so indicate when signing, and proper evidence satisfactory to Purchaser of their authority so to act must be submitted. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
this Letter of Transmittal is signed by the registered owner(s) of the Shares listed and transmitted hereby, no endorsements of Share Certificates or separate stock powers are
required unless payment is to be made to, or Share Certificates representing Shares not tendered or accepted for payment are to be issued in the name of, a person other than the registered owner(s),
in which case the Share Certificates representing the Shares tendered by this Letter of Transmittal must be endorsed or accompanied by appropriate stock powers, in either case, signed exactly as the
name(s) of the registered owner(s) or holder(s) appear(s) on the Share Certificates. Signatures on such Share Certificates or stock powers must be guaranteed by an Eligible Institution. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
this Letter of Transmittal is signed by a person other than the registered owner(s) of the Share(s) listed, the Share Certificate(s) must be endorsed or accompanied by the appropriate
stock powers, in either case, signed exactly as the name or names of the registered owner(s) or holder(s) appear(s) on the Share Certificate(s). Signatures on such Share Certificates or stock powers
must be guaranteed by an Eligible Institution. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Transfer Taxes.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided in this Instruction&nbsp;6, Purchaser will pay any transfer
taxes with respect to the transfer and sale of Shares to it or to its order pursuant to the Offer (for the avoidance of doubt, transfer taxes do not include U.S. federal income or backup withholding
taxes). If, however, payment of the Offer Price is to be made to, or (in the circumstances permitted hereby) if Share Certificates not tendered or accepted for payment are to be registered in the name
of, any person other than the registered owner(s), or if tendered Share Certificates are registered in the name of any person other than the person signing this Letter of Transmittal, the amount of
any transfer taxes (whether imposed on the registered owner(s) or such person) payable on account of the transfer to such person will be deducted from the Offer Price unless satisfactory evidence of
the payment of such taxes, or exemption therefrom, is submitted. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Except as provided in this Instruction&nbsp;6, it will not be necessary for transfer tax stamps to be affixed to the Share Certificates listed in this Letter of
Transmittal.</B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Special Payment and Delivery Instructions.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a check for the Offer Price is to be issued, and/or Share
Certificates representing Shares not tendered or accepted for payment are to be issued or returned to, a person other than the signer(s) of this Letter of Transmittal or to an address other than that
shown in the box titled "Description of Shares Tendered" above, the appropriate boxes on this Letter of Transmittal should be completed. Stockholders delivering Shares tendered hereby or by Agent's
Message by book-entry transfer may request that Shares not purchased be credited to an account maintained at DTC as such stockholder may designate in the box titled "Special Payment Instructions"
herein. If no such instructions are given, all such Shares not purchased will be returned by crediting the same account at DTC as the account from which such Shares were delivered. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Requests for Assistance or Additional Copies.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Questions or requests for assistance may be directed to D.F.
King&nbsp;&amp;&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Inc. (the "Information Agent") at their respective addresses and telephone numbers set forth below or to your broker, dealer, commercial bank or trust company.
Additional copies of the Offer to Purchase, this Letter of Transmittal, the Notice of Guaranteed Delivery and other tender offer materials may be obtained from the Information Agent as set forth
below, and will be furnished at Purchaser's expense. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Backup Withholding.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under U.S. federal income tax laws, the Depositary will be required to withhold a portion
of the amount of any payments made to certain stockholders pursuant to the Offer, as applicable. In order to avoid such backup withholding, each tendering stockholder or payee that is a United States
person (for U.S. federal income tax purposes), must provide the Depositary with such stockholder's or payee's correct taxpayer identification number ("TIN") and certify that such stockholder or payee
is not subject to such backup withholding by completing the attached IRS Form&nbsp;W-9. If a tendering U.S. stockholder has been notified by the Internal Revenue Service that such stockholder is
subject to backup withholding, such stockholder must cross out item&nbsp;2 in Part&nbsp;II of the </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=11,EFW="2226669",CP="KROGER CO.",DN="3",CHK=79401,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK106:[15ZCX4.15ZCX43304]MK43304A.;8',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='18-NOV-2015;11:47' -->

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>IRS
Form&nbsp;W-9, unless such stockholder has since been notified by the Internal Revenue Service that such stockholder is no longer subject to backup withholding. Failure to provide the
information on the IRS Form&nbsp;W-9 may subject the tendering stockholder to federal income tax withholding on the payment of the Offer Price for all Shares purchased from such stockholder. If the
tendering U.S. stockholder has not been issued a TIN and has applied for one or intends to apply for one in the near future, such stockholder should write "Applied For" in Part&nbsp;I of the IRS
Form&nbsp;W-9, and sign and date the IRS Form&nbsp;W-9. If the tendering stockholder wrote "Applied For" in Part&nbsp;I and the Depositary is not provided with a TIN by the time of payment, the
Depositary will withhold a portion of all payments of the Offer Price to such stockholder until a TIN is provided to the Depositary. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain
stockholders or payees (including, among others, corporations, and certain non-resident alien individuals and foreign entities) are not subject to these backup withholding and
reporting requirements. A tendering stockholder who is a foreign individual or a foreign entity should complete, sign, and submit to the Depositary the appropriate IRS Form&nbsp;W-8. The appropriate
IRS Form&nbsp;W-8 may
be downloaded from the Internal Revenue Service's website at the following address: </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>http://www.irs.gov.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Failure to complete the IRS Form&nbsp;W-9 or
the appropriate IRS Form&nbsp;W-8 will not, by itself, cause Shares to be deemed invalidly tendered, but may require the Depositary to withhold a portion of the amount of any payments made of the
Offer Price pursuant to the Offer. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>NOTE: FAILURE TO COMPLETE AND RETURN THE IRS FORM W-9 OR THE APPROPRIATE IRS FORM W-8 MAY RESULT IN BACKUP WITHHOLDING OF A PORTION OF ANY PAYMENTS MADE TO YOU
PURSUANT TO THE OFFER. PLEASE REVIEW THE "IMPORTANT TAX INFORMATION" SECTION BELOW.</B></FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Lost, Destroyed, Mutilated or Stolen Share Certificates.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If any Share Certificate has been lost, destroyed,
mutilated or stolen, the stockholder should promptly notify the Transfer Agent at (877)&nbsp;248-6417 (toll free in the United States) or +1 (718)&nbsp;921-8317 (international). The stockholder
will then be instructed as to the steps that must be taken in order to replace the Share Certificate. This Letter of Transmittal and related documents cannot be processed until the procedures for
replacing lost, mutilated, destroyed or stolen Share Certificates have been followed. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Waiver of Conditions.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Purchaser expressly reserves the right, in its sole discretion, to, upon the terms and
subject to the conditions of the Offer, increase the Offer Price, waive any Offer Condition (as defined in the Offer to Purchase) or make any other changes to the terms and conditions of the Offer. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>IMPORTANT: THIS LETTER OF TRANSMITTAL (OR A MANUALLY EXECUTED FACSIMILE COPY THEREOF) OR AN AGENT'S MESSAGE, TOGETHER WITH SHARE CERTIFICATE(S) OR BOOK-ENTRY
CONFIRMATION OR A PROPERLY COMPLETED AND DULY EXECUTED NOTICE OF GUARANTEED DELIVERY AND ALL OTHER REQUIRED DOCUMENTS, MUST BE RECEIVED BY THE DEPOSITARY PRIOR TO THE EXPIRATION
DATE.</B></FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=12,EFW="2226669",CP="KROGER CO.",DN="3",CHK=805106,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK106:[15ZCX4.15ZCX43304]MK43304A.;8',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='18-NOV-2015;11:47' -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="mk43304_important_tax_information"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_mk43304_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>  IMPORTANT TAX INFORMATION    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under U.S. federal income tax law, a stockholder that is a non-exempt United States person (for U.S. federal income tax purposes) whose
tendered Shares are accepted for
payment is required by law to provide the Depositary (as payer) with such stockholder's correct TIN on the IRS Form&nbsp;W-9 below. If such stockholder is an individual, the TIN is such
stockholder's social security number. If the Depositary is not provided with the correct TIN, the stockholder may be subject to penalties imposed by the Internal Revenue Service ("IRS") and payments
that are made to such stockholder with respect to Shares purchased pursuant to the Offer may be subject to backup withholding. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
backup withholding applies, the Depositary is required to withhold 28% of any payments of the Offer Price made to the stockholder. Backup withholding is not an additional tax. Rather,
the tax liability of persons subject to backup withholding will be reduced by the amount of tax withheld. If withholding results in an overpayment of taxes, a refund or credit may be obtained from the
IRS provided that the required information is furnished to the IRS. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;;margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>


<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;" -->


IRS Form&nbsp;W-9  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To prevent backup withholding on payments that are made to a U.S. stockholder with respect to Shares purchased pursuant to the Offer,
the stockholder is required to notify the Depositary of such stockholder's correct TIN by completing the IRS Form&nbsp;W-9 below, certifying, under penalties of perjury, (i)&nbsp;that the TIN
provided on the IRS Form&nbsp;W-9 is correct (or that such stockholder is awaiting a TIN), (ii)&nbsp;that such stockholder is not subject to backup withholding because (a)&nbsp;such stockholder
has not been notified by the IRS that such stockholder is subject to backup withholding as a result of a failure to report all interest or dividends, (b)&nbsp;the IRS has notified such stockholder
that such stockholder is no longer subject to backup withholding or (c)&nbsp;such stockholder is exempt from backup withholding and (iii)&nbsp;that such stockholder is a U.S. person. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;;margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>


<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;" -->


What Number to Give the Depositary  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each United States stockholder is generally required to give the Depositary its TIN (generally the stockholder's social security number
or employer identification number). If the tendering stockholder has not been issued a TIN and has applied for a number or intends to apply for a number in the near future, the stockholder should
write "Applied For" in Part&nbsp;I and sign and date the IRS Form&nbsp;W-9 below. Notwithstanding that "Applied For" is written in Part&nbsp;I, the Depositary will withhold 28% of all payments
of the Offer Price to such stockholder until a TIN is provided to the Depositary. Such amounts will be refunded to such surrendering stockholder if a TIN is provided to the Depositary within
60&nbsp;days. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;;margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>


<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;" -->


Exempt Stockholders  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain stockholders (including, among others, corporations and certain non-resident alien individuals and foreign entities) are not
subject to these backup withholding and reporting requirements. A tendering stockholder who is a foreign individual or a foreign entity should complete, sign and submit to the Depositary the
appropriate IRS Form&nbsp;W-8. The appropriate IRS Form&nbsp;W-8 may be downloaded from the IRS's website at the following address: </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>http://www.irs.gov.</I></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Please consult your accountant or tax advisor for further guidance regarding the completion of the IRS Form&nbsp;W-9, IRS Form&nbsp;W-8BEN, IRS
Form&nbsp;W-8BEN-E or another version of IRS&nbsp;Form&nbsp;W-8 to claim exemption from backup withholding, or contact the Depositary. Failure to complete the IRS&nbsp;Form&nbsp;W-9 or the
appropriate IRS&nbsp;Form&nbsp;W-8 will not, by itself, cause Shares to be deemed invalidly tendered, but may require the Depositary to withhold a portion of the amount of any payments of the
Offer Price pursuant to the Offer.</B></FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD style="font-family:times;"><p style="font-family:times;margin-left:6pt;text-indent:-6pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
 </FONT><FONT SIZE=1>Form&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=4><B>W-9<BR> </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1>(Rev. December 2014)<BR>
Department&nbsp;of&nbsp;the&nbsp;Treasury<BR>
Internal Revenue Service</FONT></TD>

</FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT COLOR="#FFFFFE" SIZE=2><B>Part I</B></FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN)</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR bgcolor="#FFFFFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_ROWSHADECOLOR,"#FFFFFF" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GUTTERGRID,"line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;" -->


 </font>&#8203;


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


 <font></FONT></TD>
<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2></font>&#8203;<font>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


</FONT></TD>
<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2></font>&#8203;



<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


 </TD>
</TR>

</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
 </DIV>
 <div
style="position:relative;float:left;width:47%;clear:left;">

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Enter your TIN in the appropriate box. The TIN provided must match the name given on line&nbsp;1 to avoid backup withholding. For individuals, this is generally your social
security number (SSN). However, for a resident alien, sole proprietor, or disregarded entity, see the Part&nbsp;I instructions on page&nbsp;3. For other entities, it is your employer
identification number (EIN). If you do not have a number, see </FONT><FONT SIZE=1><I>How to get a TIN</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> on page&nbsp;3. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Note. </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1>If the account is in more than one name, see the instructions for line&nbsp;1 and the chart on page&nbsp;4 for guidelines on whose number to
enter. </FONT></P>

</div>

<div style="position:relative;float:right;width:47%;clear:right;">
 <DIV style="padding:0pt;position:relative;width:54%;margin-left:10%;">
<p style="font-family:times;"></FONT></P>

<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_ROWSHADECOLOR,"#FFFFFF" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GUTTERGRID,"line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;" -->


 </font>&#8203;


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


 <font></FONT></TD>
<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2></font>&#8203;<font>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


</FONT></TD>
<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2></font>&#8203;



<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


 </TD>
</TR>

</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
 </DIV>
 <P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>
Under penalties of perjury, I certify that: </FONT></P>
 <DIV style="padding:0pt;position:relative;width:100%;margin-left:0%;">
<p style="font-family:times;"></FONT></P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE width="100%"  BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR><!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->

<TD WIDTH="12pt" style="font-family:times;"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="" style="font-family:times;"></TD>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS END --></TR>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>1.</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>The number shown on this form is my correct taxpayer identification number (or I am waiting for a number to be issued to me); and</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD style="font-family:times;"><BR><FONT SIZE=1> 2.</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><BR><FONT SIZE=1>I am not subject to backup withholding because: (a)&nbsp;I am exempt from backup withholding, or (b)&nbsp;I have not been notified by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) that I am subject to backup withholding as a
result of a failure to report all interest or dividends, or (c)&nbsp;the IRS has notified me that I am no longer subject to backup withholding; and</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD style="font-family:times;"><BR><FONT SIZE=1> 3.</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><BR><FONT SIZE=1>I am a U.S. citizen or other U.S. person (defined below); and</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD style="font-family:times;"><BR><FONT SIZE=1> 4.</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><BR><FONT SIZE=1>The FATCA code(s) entered on this form (if any) indicating that I am exempt from FATCA reporting is correct.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
 </DIV>
 <P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Certification instructions.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> You must cross out item&nbsp;2 above if you have been notified by the IRS that you are currently subject to backup
withholding because you have failed to report all interest and dividends on your tax return. For real estate transactions, item&nbsp;2 does not apply. For mortgage interest paid, acquisition or
abandonment of secured property, cancellation of debt, contributions to an individual retirement arrangement (IRA), and generally, payments other than interest and dividends, you are not required to
sign the certification, but you must provide your correct TIN. See the instructions on page&nbsp;3. </FONT></P>
 <DIV style="padding:0pt;position:relative;width:100%;margin-left:0%;">

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_FN1 -->
<P style="font-family:times;font-size:1pt;margin-top:-1pt;">&nbsp;</P>

<div
style="position:relative;float:left;width:47%;clear:left;">

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><BR></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;;margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>


<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;" -->


</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=3><B>General Instructions  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Section
references are to the Internal Revenue Code unless otherwise noted. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Future developments.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> Information about developments affecting Form W-9 (such as legislation enacted after we release it) is at </FONT> <FONT SIZE=1><I>www.irs.gov/fw9</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1>. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;;margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>


<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;" -->


Purpose of Form  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>An
individual or entity (Form&nbsp;W-9 requester) who is required to file an information return with the IRS must obtain your correct taxpayer identification number (TIN) which may be your social
security number (SSN), individual taxpayer identification number (ITIN), adoption taxpayer identification number (ATIN), or employer identification number (EIN), to report on an information return the
amount paid to you, or other amount reportable on an information return. Examples of information returns include, but are not limited to, the following: </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
Form 1099-INT (interest earned or paid) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
Form 1099-DIV (dividends, including those from stocks or mutual funds) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
Form 1099-MISC (various types of income, prizes, awards, or gross proceeds) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
Form 1099-B (stock or mutual fund sales and certain other transactions by brokers) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
Form 1099-S (proceeds from real estate transactions) </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
Form 1099-K (merchant card and third party network transactions) </FONT></P>

</div>

<div
style="position:relative;float:right;width:47%;clear:right;">

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
Form 1098 (home mortgage interest), 1098-E (student loan interest), 1098-T (tuition) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
Form 1099-C (canceled debt) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
Form 1099-A (acquisition or abandonment of secured property) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Use
Form W-9 only if you are a U.S. person (including a resident alien), to provide your correct TIN. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=1><I>If you do not return Form W-9 to the requester with a TIN, you might be subject to backup withholding.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> See </FONT><FONT SIZE=1><I>What is
backup withholding?</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> on page 2. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;By
signing the filled-out form, you: </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.
Certify that the TIN you are giving is correct (or you are waiting for a number to be issued), </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.
Certify that you are not subject to backup withholding, or </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.
Claim exemption from backup withholding if you are a U.S. exempt payee. If applicable, you are also certifying that as a U.S. person, your allocable share of any partnership income
from a U.S. trade or business is not subject to the withholding tax on foreign partners' share of effectively connected income, and </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.
Certify that FATCA code(s) entered on this form (if any) indicating that you are exempt from the FATCA reporting, is correct. See </FONT><FONT SIZE=1><I>What is FATCA
reporting?</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> on page 2 for further information. </FONT></P>


</div>

<div style="width:100%;clear:both;"></div>

<div
style="width:100%;clear:both;">
 <DIV style="padding:0pt;position:relative;width:100%;margin-left:0%;">
<p style="font-family:times;"></FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="12pt" style="font-family:times;"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="31%" style="font-family:times;"></TD>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS END --></TR>

<TR bgcolor="#FFFFFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_ROWSHADECOLOR,"#FFFFFF" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GUTTERGRID,"line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;" -->


 </font>&#8203;


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


 <font></FONT></TD>
<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2></font>&#8203;<font>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER" style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2></font>&#8203;


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


 <font></FONT></TD>
<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2></font>&#8203;<font>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2></font>&#8203;

<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Cat. No. 10231X</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Form </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>W-9</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> (Rev. 12-2014)</FONT></TD>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=14,EFW="2226669",CP="KROGER CO.",DN="3",CHK=974219,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK106:[15ZCX4.15ZCX43304]MM43304A.;5',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='18-NOV-2015;11:38' -->
 <DIV style="padding:0pt;position:relative;width:100%;margin-left:0%;">
<p style="font-family:times;"></FONT></P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE width="100%"  BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR><!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->
<TD WIDTH="48%" style="font-family:times;"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="12pt" style="font-family:times;"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%" style="font-family:times;"></TD>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS END --></TR>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Form W-9 (Rev. 12-2014)</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Page </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>2</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>


<HR NOSHADE SIZE="1.0pt" WIDTH="100%" COLOR="#000000">

</FONT> <FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
 </DIV>
 </div>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_FN1 -->
<P style="font-family:times;font-size:1pt;margin-top:-1pt;">&nbsp;</P>

<div
style="position:relative;float:left;width:47%;clear:left;">

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Note.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> If you are a U.S. person and a requester gives you a form other than Form&nbsp;W-9 to request your TIN, you must use the
requester's form if it is substantially similar to this Form&nbsp;W-9. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Definition of a U.S. person.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> For federal tax purposes, you are considered a U.S. person if you are: </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
An individual who is a U.S. citizen or U.S. resident alien; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
A partnership, corporation, company, or association created or organized in the United States or under the laws of the United States; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
An estate (other than a foreign estate); or </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
A domestic trust (as defined in Regulations section 301.7701-7). </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Special rules for partnerships.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> Partnerships that conduct a trade or business in the United States are generally required to pay a withholding tax under
section 1446 on any foreign partners' share of effectively connected taxable income from such business. Further, in certain cases where a Form&nbsp;W-9 has not been received, the rules under
section&nbsp;1446 require a partnership to presume that a partner is a foreign person, and pay the section&nbsp;1446 withholding tax. Therefore, if you are a U.S. person that is a partner in a
partnership conducting a trade or business in the United States, provide Form&nbsp;W-9 to the partnership to establish your U.S. status and avoid section&nbsp;1446 withholding on your share of
partnership income. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
the cases below, the following person must give Form&nbsp;W-9 to the partnership for purposes of establishing its U.S. status and avoiding withholding on its allocable share of net
income from the partnership conducting a trade or business in the United States: </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
In the case of a disregarded entity with a U.S. owner, the U.S. owner of the disregarded entity and not the entity; </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
In the case of a grantor trust with a U.S. grantor or other U.S. owner, generally, the U.S. grantor or other U.S. owner of the grantor trust and not the trust; and </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
In the case of a U.S. trust (other than a grantor trust), the U.S. trust (other than a grantor trust) and not the beneficiaries of the trust. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Foreign person.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> If you are a foreign person or the U.S. branch of a foreign bank that has elected to be treated as a U.S. person, do not use
Form&nbsp;W-9. Instead, use the appropriate Form&nbsp;W-8 or Form&nbsp;8233 (see Publication 515, Withholding of Tax on Nonresident Aliens and Foreign Entities). </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Nonresident alien who becomes a resident alien.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> Generally, only a nonresident alien individual may use the terms of a tax treaty to reduce or eliminate
U.S. tax on certain types of income. However, most tax treaties contain a provision known as a "saving clause." Exceptions specified in the saving clause may permit an exemption from tax to continue
for certain types of income even after the payee has otherwise become a U.S.&nbsp;resident alien for tax purposes. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
you are a U.S. resident alien who is relying on an exception contained in the saving clause of a tax treaty to claim an exemption from U.S. tax on certain types of income, you must
attach a statement to Form&nbsp;W-9 that specifies the following five items: </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.
The treaty country. Generally, this must be the same treaty under which you claimed exemption from tax as a nonresident alien. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.
The treaty article addressing the income. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.
The article number (or location) in the tax treaty that contains the saving clause and its exceptions. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.
The type and amount of income that qualifies for the exemption from tax. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.
Sufficient facts to justify the exemption from tax under the terms of the treaty article. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=1><B><I>Example.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> Article&nbsp;20 of the U.S.-China income tax treaty allows an exemption from tax for scholarship income received by a Chinese
student temporarily present in the United States. Under U.S. law, this student will become a resident alien for tax purposes if his or her stay in the United States exceeds 5 calendar years. However,
paragraph&nbsp;2 of the first Protocol to the U.S.-China treaty (dated April&nbsp;30, 1984) allows the provisions of Article&nbsp;20 to continue to apply even after the Chinese student becomes a
resident alien of the United States. A Chinese student who qualifies for this exception (under paragraph&nbsp;2 of the first protocol) and is relying on this exception to claim an exemption from tax
on his or her scholarship or fellowship income would attach to Form&nbsp;W-9 a statement that includes the information described above to support that exemption. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
you are a nonresident alien or a foreign entity, give the requester the appropriate completed Form&nbsp;W-8 or Form&nbsp;8233. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;;margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>


<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;" -->


</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Backup Withholding  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>What is backup withholding?</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> Persons making certain payments to you must under certain conditions withhold and pay to the IRS&nbsp;28% of such payments.
This is called "backup withholding." Payments that may be subject to backup withholding include interest, tax-exempt interest, dividends, broker and barter exchange transactions, rents, royalties,
nonemployee pay, payments made in settlement of payment card and third party network transactions, and certain payments from fishing boat operators. Real estate transactions are not subject to backup
withholding. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You
will not be subject to backup withholding on payments you receive if you give the requester your correct TIN, make the proper certifications, and report all your taxable interest and
dividends on your tax return. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Payments you receive will be subject to backup withholding if:</B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.
You do not furnish your TIN to the requester, </FONT></P>

</div>

<div style="position:relative;float:right;width:47%;clear:right;">

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.
You do not certify your TIN when required (see the Part&nbsp;II instructions on page&nbsp;3 for details), </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.
The IRS tells the requester that you furnished an incorrect TIN, </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.
The IRS tells you that you are subject to backup withholding because you did not report all your interest and dividends on your tax return (for reportable interest and dividends
only), or </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.
You do not certify to the requester that you are not subject to backup withholding under 4 above (for reportable interest and dividend accounts opened after 1983 only). </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain
payees and payments are exempt from backup withholding. See </FONT><FONT SIZE=1><I>Exempt payee code</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> on page&nbsp;3 and the separate Instructions for the
Requester of Form&nbsp;W-9 for more information. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Also
see </FONT><FONT SIZE=1><I>Special rules for partnerships</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> above. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;;margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>


<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;" -->


</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>What is FATCA reporting?  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>The
Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (FATCA) requires a participating foreign financial institution to report all United States account holders that are specified United States persons. Certain
payees are exempt from FATCA reporting. See </FONT><FONT SIZE=1><I>Exemption from FATCA reporting code</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> on page&nbsp;3 and the Instructions for the Requester of Form&nbsp;W-9
for more information. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;;margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>


<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;" -->


</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Updating Your Information  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>You
must provide updated information to any person to whom you claimed to be an exempt payee if you are no longer an exempt payee and anticipate receiving reportable payments in the future from this
person. For example, you may need to provide updated information if you are a C&nbsp;corporation that elects to be an S&nbsp;corporation, or if you no longer are tax exempt. In addition, you must
furnish a new Form&nbsp;W-9 if the name or TIN changes for the account; for example, if the grantor of a grantor trust dies. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;;margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>


<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;" -->


</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Penalties  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Failure to furnish TIN.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> If you fail to furnish your correct TIN to a requester, you are subject to a penalty of $50 for each such failure unless your
failure is due to reasonable cause and not to willful neglect. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Civil penalty for false information with respect to withholding.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> If you make a false statement with no reasonable basis that results in no backup
withholding, you are subject to a $500 penalty. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Criminal penalty for falsifying information.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> Willfully falsifying certifications or affirmations may subject you to criminal penalties including fines
and/or imprisonment. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Misuse of TINs.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> If the requester discloses or uses TINs in violation of federal law, the requester may be subject to civil and criminal penalties. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;;margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>


<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;" -->


 </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=3><B>Specific Instructions  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Line 1</B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>You must enter one of the following on this line; </FONT><FONT SIZE=1><B>do not</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> leave this line blank. The name should match the name on
your tax return. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
this Form&nbsp;W-9 is for a joint account, list first, and then circle, the name of the person or entity whose number you entered in Part&nbsp;I of Form&nbsp;W-9. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a. </FONT> <FONT SIZE=1><B>Individual.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> Generally, enter the name shown on your tax return. If you have changed your last name without informing the Social Security
Administration&nbsp;(SSA) of the name change, enter your first name, the last name as shown on your social security card, and your new last name. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Note. ITIN applicant:</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> Enter your individual name as it was entered on your Form&nbsp;W-7 application, line&nbsp;1a. This should also be the same as
the name you entered on the Form&nbsp;1040/1040A/1040EZ you filed with your application. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b. </FONT> <FONT SIZE=1><B>Sole proprietor or single-member LLC.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> Enter your individual name as shown on your 1040/1040A/1040EZ on line&nbsp;1. You may enter your
business, trade, or "doing business as" (DBA) name on line&nbsp;2. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;c.
</FONT><FONT SIZE=1><B>Partnership,&nbsp;LLC that is not a single-member LLC, C&nbsp;Corporation, or S&nbsp;Corporation.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> Enter the entity's name as shown
on the entity's tax return on line&nbsp;1 and any business, trade, or DBA name on line&nbsp;2. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;d.
</FONT><FONT SIZE=1><B>Other entities.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> Enter your name as shown on required U.S. federal tax documents on line&nbsp;1. This name should match the name shown
on the charter or other legal document creating the entity. You may enter any business, trade, or DBA name on line&nbsp;2. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;e.
</FONT><FONT SIZE=1><B>Disregarded entity.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> For U.S. federal tax purposes, an entity that is disregarded as an entity separate from its owner is treated as a
"disregarded entity." See Regulations section 301.7701-2(c)(2)(iii). Enter the owner's name on line&nbsp;1. The name of the entity entered on line 1 should never be a disregarded entity. The name on
line&nbsp;1 should be the name shown on the income tax return on which the income should be reported. For example, if a foreign LLC that is treated as a disregarded entity for U.S. federal tax
purposes has a single owner that is a U.S. person, the U.S. owner's name is required to be provided on line&nbsp;1. If the direct owner of the entity is also a disregarded entity, enter the first
owner that is not disregarded for federal tax purposes. Enter the disregarded entity's name on line&nbsp;2, "Business name/disregarded entity name." If the owner of the disregarded entity is a
foreign person, the owner must complete an appropriate Form&nbsp;W-8 instead of a Form&nbsp;W-9. This is the case even if the foreign person has a U.S. TIN. </FONT></P>

</div>

<div style="width:100%;clear:both;"></div>


<div
style="width:100%;clear:both;">

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>

 </div>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_FN1 -->
<P style="font-family:times;font-size:1pt;margin-top:-1pt;">&nbsp;</P>

<div
style="position:relative;float:left;width:47%;clear:left;">

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Line 2</B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>If you have a business name, trade name, DBA name, or disregarded entity name, you may enter it on line 2. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Line 3</B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Check the appropriate box in line&nbsp;3 for the U.S. federal tax classification of the person whose name is entered on line&nbsp;1. Check only one box in
line&nbsp;3. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Limited Liability Company (LLC).</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> If the name on line&nbsp;1 is an LLC treated as a partnership for U.S. federal tax purposes, check the "Limited
Liability Company" box and enter "P" in the space provided. If the LLC has filed Form&nbsp;8832 or 2553 to be taxed as a corporation, check the "Limited Liability Company" box and in the space
provided enter "C" for C&nbsp;corporation or "S" for S&nbsp;corporation. If it is a single-member LLC that is a disregarded entity, do not check the "Limited Liability Company" box; instead check
the first box in line&nbsp;3 "Individual/sole proprietor or single-member LLC." </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Line 4, Exemptions</B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>If you are exempt from backup withholding and/or FATCA reporting, enter in the appropriate space in line&nbsp;4 any code(s) that may apply to you. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Exempt payee code.</B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
Generally, individuals (including sole proprietors) are not exempt from backup withholding. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
Except as provided below, corporations are exempt from backup withholding for certain payments, including interest and dividends. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
Corporations are not exempt from backup withholding for payments made in settlement of payment card or third party network transactions. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;
Corporations are not exempt from backup withholding with respect to attorneys' fees or gross proceeds paid to attorneys, and corporations that provide medical or health care services are
not exempt with respect to payments reportable on Form&nbsp;1099-MISC. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following codes identify payees that are exempt from backup withholding. Enter the appropriate code in the space in line&nbsp;4. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;An
organization exempt from tax under section&nbsp;501(a), any IRA, or a custodial account under section&nbsp;403(b)(7) if the account
satisfies the requirements of section&nbsp;401(f)(2) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;The
United States or any of its agencies or instrumentalities </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
state, the District of Columbia, a U.S. commonwealth or possession, or any of their political subdivisions or instrumentalities </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
foreign government or any of its political subdivisions, agencies, or instrumentalities </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
corporation </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
dealer in securities or commodities required to register in the United States, the District of Columbia, or a U.S. commonwealth or possession </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
futures commission merchant registered with the Commodity Futures Trading Commission </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
real estate investment trust </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;An
entity registered at all times during the tax year under the Investment Company Act of 1940 </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
common trust fund operated by a bank under section&nbsp;584(a) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
financial institution </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
middleman known in the investment community as a nominee or custodian </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
trust exempt from tax under section 664 or described in section&nbsp;4947 </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following chart shows types of payments that may be exempt from backup withholding. The chart applies to the exempt payees listed above, 1 through 13. </FONT></P>
 <DIV style="padding:0pt;position:relative;width:100%;margin-left:0%;">
<p style="font-family:times;"></FONT></P>

 <font></FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Barter exchange transactions and patronage dividends</FONT></TD>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-right:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

 </DIV>
 <P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>1</SUP>
See Form 1099-MISC, Miscellaneous Income, and its instructions. </FONT></P>

</div>

<div style="position:relative;float:right;width:47%;clear:right;">


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>2</SUP>
However, the following payments made to a corporation and reportable on Form&nbsp;1099-MISC are not exempt from backup withholding: medical and health care payments, attorneys' fees,
gross proceeds paid to an attorney reportable under section&nbsp;6045(f), and payments for services paid by a federal executive agency. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Exemption from FATCA reporting code.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> The following codes identify payees that are exempt from reporting under FATCA. These codes apply to persons
submitting this form for accounts maintained outside of the United States by certain foreign financial institutions. Therefore, if you are only submitting this form for an account you hold in the
United States, you may leave this field blank. Consult with the person requesting this form if you are uncertain if the financial institution is subject to these requirements. A requester may indicate
that a code is not required by providing you with a Form&nbsp;W-9 with "Not Applicable" (or any similar indication) written or printed on the line for a FATCA exemption code. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;An
organization exempt from tax under section&nbsp;501(a) or any individual retirement plan as defined in section&nbsp;7701(a)(37) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;The
United States or any of its agencies or instrumentalities </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
state, the District of Columbia, a U.S. commonwealth or possession, or any of their political subdivisions or instrumentalities </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
corporation the stock of which is regularly traded on one or more established securities markets, as described in Regulations
section&nbsp;1.1472-1(c)(1)(i) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
corporation that is a member of the same expanded affiliated group as a corporation described in Regulations section&nbsp;1.1472-1(c)(1)(i) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;F&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
dealer in securities, commodities, or derivative financial instruments (including notional principal contracts, futures, forwards, and
options) that is registered as such under the laws of the United States or any state </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;G&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
real estate investment trust </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;H&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
regulated investment company as defined in section&nbsp;851 or an entity registered at all times during the tax year under the Investment
Company Act of 1940 </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
common trust fund as defined in section&nbsp;584(a) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;J&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
bank as defined in section&nbsp;581 </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;K&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
broker </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;L&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
trust exempt from tax under section&nbsp;664 or described in section&nbsp;4947(a)(1) </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;M&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A
tax exempt trust under a section&nbsp;403(b) plan or section&nbsp;457(g) plan </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Note.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> You may wish to consult with the financial institution requesting this form to determine whether the FATCA code and/or exempt payee code should be
completed. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Line 5</B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Enter your address (number, street, and apartment or suite number). This is where the requester of this Form W-9 will mail your information returns. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Line 6</B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Enter your city, state, and ZIP code. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;;margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>


<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;" -->


</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Part I. Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN)  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Enter your TIN in the appropriate box.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> If you are a resident alien and you do not have and are not eligible to get an SSN, your TIN is your IRS individual
taxpayer identification number (ITIN). Enter it in the social security number box. If you do not have an ITIN, see </FONT><FONT SIZE=1><I>How to get a TIN</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> below. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
you are a sole proprietor and you have an EIN, you may enter either your SSN or EIN. However, the IRS prefers that you use your SSN. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
you are a single-member LLC that is disregarded as an entity separate from its owner (see </FONT><FONT SIZE=1><I>Limited Liability Company (LLC)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> on this page),
enter the owner's SSN (or EIN, if the owner has one). Do not enter the disregarded entity's EIN. If the LLC is classified as a corporation or partnership, enter the entity's EIN. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Note.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> See the chart on page&nbsp;4 for further clarification of name and TIN combinations. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>How to get a TIN.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> If you do not have a TIN, apply for one immediately. To apply for an SSN, get Form&nbsp;SS-5, Application for a Social Security Card,
from your local SSA office or get this form online at </FONT><FONT SIZE=1><I>www.ssa.gov</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1>. You may also get this form by calling 1-800-772-1213. Use Form&nbsp;W-7, Application
for IRS Individual Taxpayer Identification Number, to apply for an ITIN, or Form&nbsp;SS-4, Application for Employer Identification Number, to apply for an EIN. You can apply for an EIN online by
accessing the IRS website at </FONT><FONT SIZE=1><I>www.irs.gov/businesses</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> and clicking on Employer Identification Number (EIN) under Starting a Business. You can get
Forms&nbsp;W-7 and SS-4 from the IRS by visiting IRS.gov or by calling 1-800-TAX-FORM (1-800-829-3676). </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
you are asked to complete Form&nbsp;W-9 but do not have a TIN, apply for a TIN and write "Applied For" in the space for the TIN, sign and date the form, and give it to the
requester. For interest and dividend payments, and certain payments made with respect to readily tradable instruments, generally you will have 60&nbsp;days to get a TIN and give it to the requester
before you are subject to backup withholding on payments. The 60-day rule does not apply to other types of payments. You will be subject to backup withholding on all such payments until you provide
your TIN to the requester. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Note.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> Entering "Applied For" means that you have already applied for a TIN or that you intend to apply for one soon. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Caution:</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1><I>A disregarded U.S. entity that has a foreign owner must use the appropriate Form&nbsp;W-8.</I></FONT></P>

</div>

<div style="width:100%;clear:both;"></div>

style="width:100%;clear:both;">

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_FN1 -->
<P style="font-family:times;font-size:1pt;margin-top:-1pt;">&nbsp;</P>

<div
style="position:relative;float:left;width:47%;clear:left;">

<P style="font-family:times;;margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>


<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"margin-left:10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;" -->


 </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Part II. Certification  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>To
establish to the withholding agent that you are a U.S. person, or resident alien, sign Form&nbsp;W-9. You may be requested to sign by the withholding agent even if items&nbsp;1, 4, or 5 below
indicate otherwise. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
a joint account, only the person whose TIN is shown in Part&nbsp;I should sign (when required). In the case of a disregarded entity, the person identified on line&nbsp;1 must
sign. Exempt payees, see </FONT><FONT SIZE=1><I>Exempt payee code</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> earlier. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Signature requirements.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> Complete the certification as indicated in items&nbsp;1 through 5 below. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=1><B>1. Interest, dividend, and barter exchange accounts opened before 1984 and broker accounts considered active during 1983.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> You must give your
correct TIN, but you do not have to sign the certification. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=1><B>2. Interest, dividend, broker, and barter exchange accounts opened after 1983 and broker accounts considered inactive during 1983.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> You must
sign the certification or backup withholding will apply. If you are subject to backup withholding and you are merely providing your correct TIN to the requester, you must cross out item&nbsp;2 in
the certification before signing the form. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=1><B>3. Real estate transactions.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> You must sign the certification. You may cross out item&nbsp;2 of the certification. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=1><B>4. Other payments.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> You must give your correct TIN, but you do not have to sign the certification unless you have been notified that you have
previously given an incorrect TIN. "Other payments" include payments made in the course of the requester's trade or business for rents, royalties, goods (other than bills for merchandise), medical and
health care services (including payments to corporations), payments to a nonemployee for services, payments made in settlement of payment card and third party network transactions, payments to certain
fishing boat crew members and fishermen, and gross proceeds paid to attorneys (including payments to corporations). </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=1><B>5. Mortgage interest paid by you, acquisition or abandonment of secured property, cancellation of debt, qualified tuition program payments (under
section&nbsp;529), IRA, Coverdell ESA, Archer MSA or HSA contributions or distributions, and pension distributions.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=1> You must give your correct TIN, but you do not have to sign
the certification. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;;margin-left:0pt;text-indent:-0pt;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>


<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"margin-left:0pt;text-indent:-0pt;" -->


</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>What Name and Number To Give the Requester  </B></FONT></P>
 <DIV style="padding:0pt;position:relative;width:100%;margin-left:0%;">
<p style="font-family:times;"></FONT></P>

 <font></FONT></TD>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B> For this type of account:</B></FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;border-right:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=1>

&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><B> Give name and SSN of:<BR> </B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR bgcolor="#FFFFFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=1>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_ROWSHADECOLOR,"#FFFFFF" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GUTTERGRID,"line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;" -->


 </font>&#8203;


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


 </TD>
<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=1></font>&#8203;<font>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


</FONT>
</TD>
<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=1> </font>&#8203;


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


 <font></FONT></TD>
<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=1></font>&#8203;<font>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER" style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=1></font>&#8203;


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


 <font></FONT></TD>
<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=1></font>&#8203;<font>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


</FONT></TD>
<TD style="line-height:0pt;font-size:1.5pt;font-family:times;border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;"><FONT SIZE=1> </font>&#8203;


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"border-bottom:solid #000000 1.0pt;" -->


 </TD>
</TR>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>1.</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1> Individual</FONT></TD>
